title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 ยง 11.121 - Entry level qualifications
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 ยง 11.121 - Entry level qualifications

State Regulations
A public health technician must possess an associate degree from a regionally accredited or New York State-registered college or university or have completed 60 credit hours, with a minimum of 15 credit hours in the natural sciences, of which not more than six credit hours may be in the applied sciences, and have satisfactory completed a public health training course approved by the State Health Department within two years of appointment. Notes

11.121

comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
